name: Learn about Google Cloud Platform at the first GCP Montreal Meetup

venue.name: Shopify
venue.address_1: 0B3, 490 Rue de la Gaucheti√®re O, Montreal, Qu√©bec H2Z

description:
Google has officially opened its first Google Cloud Platform (GCP) region in Canada, located in Montreal at the beginning of the year 2018.

Today we are excited to announce the first Montreal Google Cloud Platform Meetup in Montreal!

Join us on Thursday, 21st June 2018 to learn about GCP platform ecosystem and other open source projects that Google is contributing to, or that integrate with GCP.

One of these projects, Istio*, has its first birthday coming up and we want to celebrate it along with this Meetup. Further, Istio 0.8 LTS is hot off the press, check out the release notes**, it‚Äôs packed with awesome new features and a bit of re-branding (Citadel üòç).

Cake, beer and food will be served.

Agenda:

- Intro by Francois Lapierre Messier @Google

- GKE Deep Dive (part 1) by Jonathan Pulsifer @Shopify

- Using Calico networking with GKE and what's next? by Christopher Liljenstolpe CEO of Tigera;

- Istio one year after by Ayrat Khayretdinov - CNCF Ambassador;

- Discussion what community wants to learn and share in GCP Meetups.

If anyone has feedback or is otherwise interested in contributing to this meetup (with a talk, workshop, sponsorship), or for any other inquiries, please get in contact with our Meetup leadership team***.

please message the organizers (Jonathan Pulsifer, Tatiana Andreeva, Ayrat).

name: Next '18 Extended Montreal
description:
We are hosting a Next' 18 Extended event here in Montreal, to review some of the key announcements of the main event to be held in San Francisco, July 24-27 (https://cloud.withgoogle.com/next18).

Agenda:
* Intro by Google Canada team
* Google Next 2018 key announcements by Ayrat Khayretdinov, Jonathan Pulsifer
* Machine Learning free hands-on Labs
* Extras: Access to selected GCP trainings at Coursera

Hopefully will have more swag this time!

Please note that there is a hands-on code lab included. If you plan to attend, please bring your laptop!

See you soon!
GDG Montreal Meetup Org committee
how_to_find_us: Meetup is going to be on 8th floor!

name: CI/CD with Spinnaker on GCP
description:
Allo! On finit l'ann√©e avec un meetup GCP exclusive!
On est fi√®re de vous presenter notre derni√®re rencontre avant les temps de f√™tes avec l'√©quipe d'Armory.io

Merci infiniment √† Banque National de nous accueillir! Pizza et boissons inclus
***
We are finishing a year with an exclusive GCP meetup!
We are super happy to see you again and invite special guest - Team Armory.io

Thanks to National Bank for making this possible by hosting us. Pizza and refreshments will always be included :)

Agenda:
Talk # 1 GCP Update by Ayrat Khayretdinov and team Google Montreal.
[15 mins]

Talk #2 - Your First Pipeline by Brandon Powell, Software Engineer at Armory [40 mins]
Language - English

When people first learn about Spinnaker and are building pipelines, they start with something extremely basic. When your pipeline is too basic, it's hard to see how to build a production level pipeline. This presentation will show you how to build a pipelines that is triggered off of a Docker image being updated and then deployed to Kuberenetes.

Talk #3 - Why Do Pipelines Fail? by Kevin Woo, Senior Software Engineer at Armory [40 mins]
Language - English

Kevin will discuss best practices for creating pipelines in Spinnaker and how to debug them when they fail.
how_to_find_us: You can find us on 8th floor. Security on the first floor will guide you towards elevator.

name: TensorFlow Dev Summit Montreal Viewing Party
description:
Welcome back! We starting a year with GDG Cloud Meetup related to TensorFlow Dev Summit event. With great talks, hands-on and viewing Party. A huge thanks to Google for making this possible by hosting us.

---
Pr√©sentations/Talk Schedule:

Talk #1: Tensorflow Dev Summit Keynotes.
By Archy, CNCF Ambassador

Talk #2: Hands on Intro to TensorFlow 2.0

Length: 60 mins

Description: The TensorFlow 2.0 preview is here! Please join us for this short, hands-on intro. We will train several different flavors of neural networks (Dense, Convolutional, and GANs) in two different styles: Keras Sequential and Keras Subclassing. Please bring a laptop. There is nothing to install in advance (we will use colab.research.google.com). We'll leave plenty of time for Q&A as well.

Short bio: Josh Gordon is a Developer Advocate working on TensorFlow, and teaches Deep Learning at Columbia University. You can find him on Twitter at https://twitter.com/random_forests
